item.title: Spring-Internals-List
item.description:
Spring Internals List

item.description:
Spring List

  • 2020-SpringBoot-Labs : ä¸€ä¸ªæ¶µç›–å…­ä¸ªä¸“æ ï¼šSpring Boot 2.Xã€Spring Cloudã€Spring Cloud Alibabaã€Dubboã€åˆ†å¸ƒå¼æ¶ˆæ¯é˜Ÿåˆ—ã€åˆ†å¸ƒå¼äº‹åŠ¡çš„ä»“åº“ã€‚å¸Œæœ›èƒ–å‹å°æ‰‹ä¸€æŠ–ï¼Œå³ä¸Šè§’æ¥ä¸ª Starï¼Œæ„Ÿæ© 1024.

  • 2020-spring-boot-quick : ğŸŒ¿ åŸºäº springboot çš„å¿«é€Ÿå­¦ä¹ ç¤ºä¾‹,æ•´åˆè‡ªå·±é‡åˆ°çš„å¼€æºæ¡†æ¶,å¦‚ï¼šrabbitmq(å»¶è¿Ÿé˜Ÿåˆ—)ã€Kafkaã€jpaã€rediesã€oauth2ã€swaggerã€jspã€dockerã€k3sã€k3dã€k8sã€mybatis åŠ è§£å¯†æ’ä»¶ã€å¼‚å¸¸å¤„ç†ã€æ—¥å¿—è¾“å‡ºã€å¤šæ¨¡å—å¼€å‘ã€å¤šç¯å¢ƒæ‰“åŒ…ã€ç¼“å­˜ cacheã€çˆ¬è™«ã€jwtã€GraphQLã€dubboã€zookeeper å’Œ Async ç­‰ç­‰ ğŸ“Œ

Tutorial

  • 2017-Docker Spring Boot Microservice (with Gradle): Step-by-step tutorial on how to create a Spring Boot Microservice and wrap it up using Docker for simple, better and safer deployments of redundant APIs.

  • Spring Boot and Security Events with Actuator

  • We will cover the concept of HTTP protocol, servlets, web services, REST and JSON.

  • Unit Test Spring MVC Rest Service: MockMVC, JUnit, Mockito

  • Remoting and web services using Spring

Spring Native

item.title: Spring-OpenSource-List
item.description:
Spring OpenSource List

  • SOFABoot : SOFABoot is a framework that enhances Spring Boot and fully compatible with it, provides readiness check, class isolation, etc.

  • Springfox : Automated JSON API documentation for API’s built with Spring.

  • Nepxion Discovery : ğŸ³ Nepxion Discovery is an enhancement for Spring Cloud Discovery on Eureka + Consul + Zookeeper + Nacos with Nacos + Apollo config for gray release, router, weight, isolation ç½‘å…³å’ŒæœåŠ¡ç°åº¦å‘å¸ƒã€è·¯ç”±ã€æƒé‡ã€éš”ç¦»ã€è°ƒç”¨é“¾ã€‚

  • Spring Native : Spring Native provides support for compiling Spring applications to native executables using the GraalVM native-image compiler.

Showcase

Boilerplate

  • 2016-zheng : åŸºäº Spring SpringMVC Mybatis åˆ†å¸ƒå¼æ•æ·å¼€å‘ç³»ç»Ÿæ¶æ„ï¼Œæä¾›æ•´å¥—å…¬å…±å¾®æœåŠ¡æœåŠ¡æ¨¡å—ï¼šé›†ä¸­æƒé™ç®¡ç†ï¼ˆå•ç‚¹ç™»å½•ï¼‰ã€å†…å®¹ç®¡ç†ã€æ”¯ä»˜ä¸­å¿ƒã€ç”¨æˆ·ç®¡ç†ï¼ˆæ”¯æŒç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹ç™»å½•ï¼‰ã€å¾®ä¿¡å¹³å°ã€å­˜å‚¨ç³»ç»Ÿã€é…ç½®ä¸­å¿ƒã€æ—¥å¿—åˆ†æã€ä»»åŠ¡å’Œé€šçŸ¥ç­‰ï¼Œæ”¯æŒæœåŠ¡æ²»ç†ã€ç›‘æ§å’Œè¿½è¸ªï¼ŒåŠªåŠ›ä¸ºä¸­å°å‹ä¼ä¸šæ‰“é€ å…¨æ–¹ä½ J2EE ä¼ä¸šçº§å¼€å‘è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆã€‚

  • hope-boot : ä¸€æ¬¾ç°ä»£åŒ–çš„è„šæ‰‹æ¶é¡¹ç›®ã€‚ä¼ä¸šå¼€å‘ï¼Ÿæ¥å¤–åŒ…ï¼Ÿèµšå¤–å¿«ï¼Ÿè¿˜æ˜¯å­¦ä¹ ï¼Ÿè¿™éƒ½èƒ½æ»¡è¶³ä½ ï¼Œå±…å®¶å¿…å¤‡ï¼Œå€¼å¾—æ‹¥æœ‰ ğŸ»

  • microservices-platform : åŸºäº SpringBoot2.xã€SpringCloud å’Œ SpringCloudAlibaba å¹¶é‡‡ç”¨å‰åç«¯åˆ†ç¦»çš„ä¼ä¸šçº§å¾®æœåŠ¡å¤šç§Ÿæˆ·ç³»ç»Ÿæ¶æ„ã€‚å¹¶å¼•å…¥ç»„ä»¶åŒ–çš„æ€æƒ³å®ç°é«˜å†…èšä½è€¦åˆï¼Œé¡¹ç›®ä»£ç ç®€æ´æ³¨é‡Šä¸°å¯Œä¸Šæ‰‹å®¹æ˜“ï¼Œé€‚åˆå­¦ä¹ å’Œä¼ä¸šä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚çœŸæ­£å®ç°äº†åŸºäº RBACã€jwt å’Œ oauth2 çš„æ— çŠ¶æ€ç»Ÿä¸€æƒé™è®¤è¯çš„è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Œé¢å‘äº’è”ç½‘è®¾è®¡åŒæ—¶é€‚åˆ B ç«¯å’Œ C ç«¯ç”¨æˆ·ï¼Œæ”¯æŒ CI/CD å¤šç¯å¢ƒéƒ¨ç½²ï¼Œå¹¶æä¾›åº”ç”¨ç®¡ç†æ–¹ä¾¿ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹ç³»ç»Ÿæ¥å…¥ï¼›åŒæ—¶è¿˜é›†åˆå„ç§å¾®æœåŠ¡æ²»ç†åŠŸèƒ½å’Œç›‘æ§åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚æ¨¡å—åŒ…æ‹¬:ä¼ä¸šçº§çš„è®¤è¯ç³»ç»Ÿã€å¼€å‘å¹³å°ã€åº”ç”¨ç›‘æ§ã€æ…¢ sql ç›‘æ§ã€ç»Ÿä¸€æ—¥å¿—ã€å•ç‚¹ç™»å½•ã€Redis åˆ†å¸ƒå¼é«˜é€Ÿç¼“å­˜ã€é…ç½®ä¸­å¿ƒã€åˆ†å¸ƒå¼ä»»åŠ¡è°ƒåº¦ã€æ¥å£æ–‡æ¡£ã€ä»£ç ç”Ÿæˆç­‰ç­‰ã€‚

å“åº”å¼

  • 2020-hsweb-framework : hsweb (haÊŠs wÉ›b) æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŸºäº spring-boot 2.x å¼€å‘ ,é¦–ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨å…¨å“åº”å¼ç¼–ç¨‹çš„ä¼ä¸šçº§åå°ç®¡ç†ç³»ç»ŸåŸºç¡€é¡¹ç›®ã€‚

Libraries

Log

  • 2021-plumelog : ä¸€ä¸ª Java åˆ†å¸ƒå¼æ—¥å¿—ç»„ä»¶ï¼Œæ”¯æŒç™¾äº¿çº§åˆ«ï¼Œæ—¥å¿—ä»æœé›†åˆ°æŸ¥è¯¢ï¼Œä¸ç”¨å»æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ç¿»é˜…æ—¥å¿—æ–¹ä¾¿å¿«æ·ï¼Œæ”¯æŒæŸ¥è¯¢ä¸€ä¸ªè°ƒç”¨é“¾çš„æ—¥å¿—ï¼Œæ”¯æŒé“¾è·¯è¿½è¸ªï¼ŒæŸ¥çœ‹è°ƒç”¨é“¾è€—æ—¶æƒ…å†µï¼Œåœ¨åˆ†å¸ƒå¼ç³»ç»Ÿä¸­ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æŸ¥è¯¢å…³è”æ—¥å¿—ï¼Œèƒ½å¤Ÿå¸®åŠ©å¿«é€Ÿå®šä½é—®é¢˜ï¼Œç®€å•æ˜“ç”¨ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰ä»£ç å…¥ä¾µï¼ŒæŸ¥è¯¢ç•Œé¢å‹å¥½ï¼Œé«˜æ•ˆï¼Œæ–¹ä¾¿ï¼Œåªè¦ä½ æ˜¯ java ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œä¸è¦åšä»»ä½•é¡¹ç›®æ”¹é€ ï¼Œæ¥å…¥ç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œæ—¥å¿—ä¸è½æœ¬åœ°ç£ç›˜ã€‚

  • 2021-mzt-biz-log : æ”¯æŒ Springbootï¼ŒåŸºäºæ³¨è§£çš„å¯ä½¿ç”¨å˜é‡ã€å¯ä»¥è‡ªå®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°çš„é€šç”¨æ“ä½œæ—¥å¿—ç»„ä»¶ã€‚

  • 2022-log-record : ä½¿ç”¨æ³¨è§£ä¼˜é›…çš„è®°å½•ç³»ç»Ÿæ—¥å¿—ï¼Œæ“ä½œæ—¥å¿—ç­‰ï¼Œæ”¯æŒ SpEL è¡¨è¾¾å¼ï¼Œè‡ªå®šä¹‰ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡ï¼Œè‡ªå®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå®ä½“ç±» DIFFã€‚å¹¶æ”¯æŒå°†æ—¥å¿—æ¶ˆæ¯ä¼ é€’è‡³æ¶ˆæ¯é˜Ÿåˆ—ã€‚

Web Development

Frameworks

  • cicada : Fast, lightweight Web framework based on Netty; without too much dependency, and the core jar package is only 30KB.

  • Ninja : Ninja is a full stack web framework for Java. Rock solid, fast and super productive.

  • 2018-JFinal : JFinal æ˜¯åŸºäº Java è¯­è¨€çš„æé€Ÿ WEB + ORM æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œå…¶æ ¸å¿ƒè®¾è®¡ç›®æ ‡æ˜¯å¼€å‘è¿…é€Ÿã€ä»£ç é‡å°‘ã€å­¦ä¹ ç®€å•ã€åŠŸèƒ½å¼ºå¤§ã€è½»é‡çº§ã€æ˜“æ‰©å±•ã€Restfulã€‚åœ¨æ‹¥æœ‰ Java è¯­è¨€æ‰€æœ‰ä¼˜åŠ¿çš„åŒæ—¶å†æ‹¥æœ‰ rubyã€python ç­‰åŠ¨æ€è¯­è¨€çš„å¼€å‘æ•ˆç‡ï¼

  • Spark : A simple expressive web framework for java. News: Spark now has a kotlin DSL.

  • 2017-Micronaut : A modern, JVM-based, full-stack framework for building modular, easily testable microservice and serverless applications.

  • 2017-Quarkus : A Kubernetes Native Java stack tailored for OpenJDK HotSpot and GraalVM, crafted from the best of breed Java libraries and standards.

Auth

  • Spring Security : Spring Security provides security services for the Spring IO Platform. Spring Security 5.0 requires Spring 5.0 as a minimum and also requires Java 8.

  • pac4j : Security engine for Java (authentication, authorization, multi frameworks): OAuth, CAS, SAML, OpenID Connect, LDAP, JWT…

  • buji-pac4j : The buji-pac4j project is an easy and powerful security library for Shiro web applications and web services which supports authentication and authorization, but also advanced features like CSRF protection. It’s based on Java 8, Shiro 1.4 and on the pac4j security engine v3.

  • Apache Shiro : Apache Shiro is a powerful and easy-to-use Java security framework that performs authentication, authorization, cryptography, and session management.

item.title: SpringBoot-List

item.title: SpringSecurity-List
item.description:
Spring Security List

  • 2018-Security with Spring #Series#: The Security with Spring tutorials focus, as you’d expect, on Spring Security. Get started with the Registration series if you’re interested in building a registration flow, and understanding some of the frameworks basics. Then, explore the topics you’re most interested in, related to security. Finally, have a look at some of the more advanced topics, such as the OAuth support.

  • 2020-Spring security tutorials and examples #Series#: This tutorial describes the usage and importance of Spring security with lots of examples.

Spring Security 5

  • Spring Security Series #Series#: With the latest Spring Security release, a lot has changed. One of those changes is how we can handle password encoding in our applications.

JWT

  • 2017-Spring Boot Security Jwt Authentication: In this post we will be securing our REST APIs with JWT(JSOn Web Token) authentication. We will be using spring boot maven based configuration to develop and secure our APIs with seperate API for signup and generate token.

  • Securing Spring Boot with JWTs: Learn how to set up a Spring Boot project using Java, and secure it with JWTs.

SSO

  • 2019-A Quick Guide to Using Keycloak with Spring Boot: In this article, weâ€™ll cover the basics of setting up a Keycloak server, how to connect a Spring Boot application to it, and how to use it with Spring Security.

  • 2019-CAS SSO With Spring Security: In this article, weâ€™re going to look at integrating the Central Authentication Service (CAS) with Spring Security. CAS is a Single Sign-On (SSO) service.

SQL Injection

  • 2016-A beginnerâ€™s guide to SQL injection and how you should prevent it
